title: Can you not buff the baron creeps even more?
body:
It is already hard to do anything vs baron push. Game is clown snowball fiesta. One even slight mistake at 20 minutes and enemy takes baron and you can't do anything. Meele creeps are god damn immortal. If you dont have some champion with HUGE wave clear capabilities that can clear effeciently without losing too much resources (e.g. I found Sivir to be basically the only one champion who can stop baron empowered minions waves and supers waves and make it able for team to comeback maybe) you can just abandon those turrets and let enemy take everything they want. And now you want to give damage reduction to casters as well. Like WTF? 

You also want to make scaling AD/AP bonus from Baron even stronger. Same for Elder. Maybe first make it actually hard to take those objectives? Taking baron is so god damn easy. This is a huge objective that gives massive advantage. At this point in meta it's impossible to get negative power play with baron. You can't go wrong with baron buff. Baron should be hard as hell to kill. 4 people minimum to do it. Same for Elder drake. I feel sometimes its harder to do rift herald actually than baron. 

Don't make this game snowball even harder than it already is. If you want 99% of the games ending under 25 minutes then you are on a good way. Though it will ruin this game even further. Also I think Baron should be just as Elder spawning near 30th minute. That would actually help to create possible comebacks based on ability to play it out slowly.

replies.body:
"We realized that some games still end above 25mins and listened to your feedback. So we are buffing snowballing even harder so you can ff 15 as soon as the score is 0/3.

Pls share more of your ideas on how to not flush this game down the shitter and we will continue to ignore them"

If you want the reason behind the change it's beause of LCS so the teams actually do something and not farm for 60mins.

Of course Riot being Riot they don't realize that this will make it so the teams will farm for 80mins now.
I don't understand how this decreases game time? Elder changes don't even take effect until second elder dragon iirc, and baron isn't buffed until 27+ minutes. That's not exactly a short game.

Are you kidding?

Back in Season 5 there was a disclaimer before you started a game

"A 5v5 Summoners Rift game takes up about 30-45mins"

27min was a short game

Around 35min was the norm

40+ were longer games

The fact that you call a 27min game "not short" shows what Riot has done to this game

edit: why do you think the 15min surrender was added? It surely isn't because matches became longer

and back in the day you actually had some (not all the time but like 30-40% of the time) cameback potential. 
When you had a Kog on your team and he soon hit his powerspike with the 4th item you knew there is a chance to come back since the enemy had a early game oriented ADC

Or a Nasus or a Veigar or a Jax

Dude Jax was the king of late game you would hear phrases like "they have a Jax we need to end quick"

Right now when someone says that you would think he is trolling

But now the "late game carries" hit the damn powerspike at 1 to 1.5 items and you might as well surr because your "late game carry" isn't as far ahead as the enemies and since both are "late game carries" the one wont outscale the other in any part of the game until full build.

And guess what! That Baron seals off the game at 27min doesn't help to reach that full build.

I mean just my opinion, but I don't think 45 minute games should be the norm. 30-35 minutes is around what I think the average game time should be, some longer some shorter. Under that lens, 27 minute buffed baron isn't going to significantly enhance the snowball effect. Most of the snowballing comes well before that point.

27 isn't long, but it's not very short either.

Yes and that is why the norm was 35min ish

"this isn't going to significantly enhance snowballing"
"this shouldn't do it too"
"this one shouldn't buff it too hard too"
"that one just buffs it a little bit"
"oh this one is just a tiny change"

See where this leads?

NO! we DONT need anymore snowballing! It doesn't matter how small the buff to snowballing is we don't need this buff nobody asked for this stupid buff!
You might as well just make the 15min surr to not need 5/0 and add a 12 or 13min with 5/0

This just NEEDS to stop I couldn't give less of a shit if the LCS became a 40min farm snoozefest, they shouldn't have kicked the game pacing in a center of an erupting volcano in the first place!

They need to go back not dig a hole deeper into the fucking volcano

Worst part is teams can still take 35 minutes to close out a game officially even though they've clearly won and could do it any moment. Quite literally all Riot's done is make the games feel ten times worse and more stressful versus actually shortening them efficiently.

27 minutes used to be roflstomps in season 4.

Games got shorter because of people with an attention span similar to a bloody goldfish and LC$.

At least the LCS had a reason to be bothered about 40+ minute games in close BO5s, it's hard on the players.

>
> learn vision control?

On my ELO, enemy team buys lens.
It's harder to take down Baron minions than it is to take down Baron.
Nice one, you almost got me.

> I feel sometimes its harder to do rift herald actually than baron.

Are we playing the same game?
It's easier to do rift herald, but the time investment is certainly contentious (because a lot of damage to it is from that eye).

Rift Herald is supposed to take long because the buff only spawns one time and the buff is extremely powerful relative to when you should be getting it. It's basically a free tower which is really powerful early on especially if no team has tower first blood yet (pretty unlikely ngl but still it's a possiblity.) Also usually only 2 people are doing rift at one time. Meanwhile with baron 4-5 people have to be there unless you have a champion who can cheese the baron super hard like {{champion:74}} or {{champion:82}} or if you have a sustained damage carry (usually adc but can be a melee carry like Yi, Yasuo, Trynd etc.) that's super fed and even then unless that carry has built in sustain and insane lifesteal you need to have a champion tanky enough to take the entire baron damage because the person who has baron aggro deals 50% less damage to baron.
yeah this is the type of opinions and whine that get up-voted...
They literally only buffed it as the game goes on. Early it's not getting buffed, unless you count giving AP champs a more equitable amount of stats.

Not entirely true, the empowered Siege minions do much more damage to turrets now, and empowered Caster minions take 50% reduced damage, which I think is pretty hefty since it makes clearing them even harder

All those changes, have proven that Riot is going to kill the comeback mechanism and increase one sided snowball potential. 

Don't you guys realize that? It has slowly turned into fast-paced, MOBA like mobile game's?

"Taking baron is so god damn easy".

Because people don't ward it. Because they don't TP to it. Because they don't dive the enemy team that is taking it and has their armor and MR heavily reduced, making them easy prey for anyone who tries to stop them.

Baron itself isn't hard to kill. But killing the team that is killing baron is even easier, people just don't even try to stop it. Now they will, and that is actual PVP combat in the mid game, which we need more of.

That's the point. Baron shouldn't be easy to take. Its how easy it is to do makes it hard to counter anything and comeback in the game. You wanted to farm up a bit and get back to the game? Sorry 20 minute baron taken in 3 sec by enemy will make it impossible for you to farm because game is about to end.

You should not be able to "farm up a bit" to get back into the game. If you lost the early game because your opponent out PVPed you, the only option should be to PVP them back. This game is about fighting other players, not minions.

How in the seven hells are you supposed to PVP them back when they have item and level advantage? Unless they make mistakes. But lets be honest know, hoping the enemy makes mistakes is unreliable and frankly, bad gameplay design.

If you can't PVP them back when you are behind in items and levels, then you've lost from the beginning. Turtling isn't going to close the XP or level advantage, the enemy team will still be playing the game. They don't suddenly stop farming and building items because you all stay in base.

> If you can't PVP them back when you are behind in items and levels, then you've lost from the beginning. 

Too bad this is bad gameplay design. You shouldnt lose the game just because you did some mistakes in the beginning. Or because your  champ is a late game champ.  

> Turtling isn't going to close the XP or level advantage

Ofc it is not. But it should be enough to help for a comeback. Which soon will not be.

The alternative to "you shouldn't lose the game just because you did some mistakes in the beginning" is "you shouldn't win the game just because you managed to play well in the beginning". Which is exactly what the top and mid laners have been bitching about for a year now. They want solo carry potential back. This is how you allow for solo carry potential, you eliminate the ability of the enemy team to stall out.

I dont recall me saying that i want back solo carry potential. I want the other lanes (besides bot) to have a chance to win against a fed bot. Or not losing because their adc is a hyper carry and reached its powerspike in 25 mins.
Well, if players can't easily finish games that they are winning, hyper carries will be the only carries you can play because you are always guaranteed to hit your power spike.
